Description: This registry defines the events for the management processor.

AdapterConfigurationChange.Description: The specified adapter has had a configuration change.
AdapterConfigurationChange.Message: The adapter in slot %1 has had a configuration change.

AutoShutdownCancelled.Description: Management processor cancelled previously initiated automatic operating system shutdown.
AutoShutdownCancelled.Message: Management processor cancelled previously initiated automatic operating system shutdown. Cause: %1.

AutoShutdownInitiated.Description: Management processor initiated an automatic operating system shutdown.
AutoShutdownInitiated.Message: Management processor initiated an automatic operating system shutdown. Cause: %1.
AutoShutdownInitiated.Resolution: Check shutdown cause and the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

BIOSSafeModeEngaged.Description: BIOS Safe Mode is engaged. System will boot in a minimal configuration.
BIOSSafeModeEngaged.Message: BIOS Safe Mode is engaged. System will boot in a minimal configuration.

BIOSSafeModeExit.Description: BIOS Safe Mode has successfully booted. System will resume boot in a minimal configuration.
BIOSSafeModeExit.Message: BIOS Safe Mode has successfully booted. System will resume boot in a minimal configuration.

BatteryBackupUnitError.Message: Battery Backup Unit: %1 (Power Supply  chassis %2, bay %3)
BatteryBackupUnitError.Resolution: Check error condition and the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

BatteryBackupUnitErrorRepaired.Message: Battery Backup Unit Repaired: %1 (Power Supply  chassis %2, bay %3)

BundleUpdateFailed.Message: Bundle update failed due to invalid install set file.
BundleUpdateFailed.Resolution: Verify the contents of the install set file and retry the Bundle Update.

ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSCo.Description: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to CCS connectivity issue.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSCo.Message: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to CCS connectivity issue for the endpoint URL %1.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSCo.Resolution: Please check the DNS and proxy configuration settings. Contact support if the problem persists.

ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSEr.Description: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSEr.Message: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to CCS error reason %1.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCCSEr.Resolution: Visit cloud.hpe.com and confirm that the serial number and productID of this Management Processor has been added correctly to the device inventory and retry this operation OR Check the proxy settings. Contact support if the problem persists.

ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCertE.Description: Compute Cloud Console activation is incomplete.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCertE.Message: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to certificate related failures.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedCertE.Resolution: Please check the Management Processor's date/time and proxy settings. Contact support if the problem persists.

ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedRDACo.Description: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to RDA connectivity issue.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedRDACo.Message: Compute Cloud Console activation is not complete due to RDA connectivity issue for the endpoint URL %1.
ComputeCloudConsoleActivationFailedRDACo.Resolution: Please check the DNS and proxy configuration settings. Contact support if the problem persists.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnected.Description: Compute Cloud Console connection status is changed to Connected.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnected.Message: Compute Cloud Console connection status is Connected.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionFailed.Description: Compute Cloud Console connection status is changed to Failed.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionFailed.Message: Compute Cloud Console connection is failed.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInProgress.Description: Compute Cloud Console connection status is changed to In Progress.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInProgress.Message: Compute Cloud Console connection is in progress.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInitiated.Description: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been initiated.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInitiated.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been initiated by: %1.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInterrupted.Description: Connection to Compute Cloud Console is interrupted.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInterrupted.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console is interrupted. Automatic retry to establish connection will be attempted again in %1 hours.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionInterrupted.Resolution: Please check the DNS and proxy server settings. Reset the management processor for re-initiating the connection immediately. Refer User Guide for more information.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionNotEnabled.Description: Compute Cloud Console connection status is changed to Not Enabled.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionNotEnabled.Message: Compute Cloud Console is not Enabled.

ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionSuccessful.Description: Connection to Compute Cloud Console is successful.
ComputeCloudConsoleConnectionSuccessful.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console is successful.

ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledByFactoryDefa.Description: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been disabled due to Factory defaults.
ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledByFactoryDefa.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been disabled due to Factory defaults.

ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledBySecureErase.Description: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been disabled due to secure erase.
ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledBySecureErase.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been disabled due to secure erase by user %1.

ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledByUser.Description: User has disabled connection to Compute Cloud Console.
ComputeCloudConsoleDisabledByUser.Message: Connection to Compute Cloud Console has been disabled by User %1.

CorrectableOrUncorrectableMemoryErrors.Description: Correctable or uncorrectable Memory Errors Detected. Correctable errors have been corrected, but the memory module should be replaced.
CorrectableOrUncorrectableMemoryErrors.Message: Memory Errors detected for the memory module in slot %1, cpu %2, riser %3, socket %4.

DeviceDiscoveryStatusV2.Description: The server device discovery status has changed.
DeviceDiscoveryStatusV2.Message: Discovery status is now: AMS: %1, Device Discovery: %2, Smart Array Storage: %3

DriveFailed.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 has failed.

DriveFailed2.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed.

DriveInserted.Description: The ATA drive has been inserted into the specified location.
DriveInserted.Message: The ATA drive has been inserted in location %1.

DriveInserted2.Description: The ATA drive has been inserted into the specified location.
DriveInserted2.Message: The ATA drive has been inserted in location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DriveOk.Description: The ATA drive is functioning properly.
DriveOk.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 is functioning properly.

DriveOk2.Description: The ATA drive is functioning properly.
DriveOk2.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is functioning properly.

DriveRemoved.Description: The ATA drive has been removed from the specified location.
DriveRemoved.Message: The ATA drive has been removed from location %1.

DriveRemoved2.Description: The ATA drive has been removed from the specified location.
DriveRemoved2.Message: The ATA drive has been removed from location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DriveSmartError.Description: The ATA drive has a error predictive failure error.
DriveSmartError.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 has a predictive failure error.

DriveSmartError2.Description: The ATA drive has a error predictive failure error.
DriveSmartError2.Message: The ATA drive at at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has a predictive failure error.

DriveWearOut.Description: The ATA drive is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DriveWearOut.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DriveWearOut.Resolution: Replace the drive as soon as possible.

DriveWearOut2.Description: The ATA drive is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DriveWearOut2.Message: The ATA drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DriveWearOut2.Resolution: Replace the drive as soon as possible.

DriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is FiftySixDayThreshold.
DriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 is FiftySixDayThreshold.

DriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold2.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is FiftySixDayThreshold.
DriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold2.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is FiftySixDayThreshold.

DriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is FivePercentThreshold.
DriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 is FivePercentThreshold.

DriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold2.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is FivePercentThreshold.
DriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold2.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is FivePercentThreshold.

DriveWearStatusOk.Description: The ATA Drive wear status is ok.
DriveWearStatusOk.Message: The ATA Drive wear status for the disk at location %1 is ok.

DriveWearStatusOk2.Description: The ATA Drive wear status is ok.
DriveWearStatusOk2.Message: The ATA Drive wear status for the disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is ok.

DriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is TwoPercentThreshold.
DriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 is TwoPercentThreshold.

DriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold2.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is TwoPercentThreshold.
DriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold2.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is TwoPercentThreshold.

DriveWearStatusWearOut.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is wear out.
DriveWearStatusWearOut.Message: The ATA drive wear status for the disk at location %1 is wear out.
DriveWearStatusWearOut.Resolution: Replace the drive the status indicate wear out.

DriveWearStatusWearOut2.Description: The ATA drive wear status threshold is wear out.
DriveWearStatusWearOut2.Message: The wear status for the ATA drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is wear out.
DriveWearStatusWearOut2.Resolution: Replace the drive the status indicate wear out.

DrvArrAcceleratorFlashMemoryNotAttached.Description: Flash memory component of the flash backed cache module is not attached.
DrvArrAcceleratorFlashMemoryNotAttached.Message: Flash memory component of the flash backed cache module is not attached for cache module board located in %1.

DrvArrControllerFailed.Description: The drive array controller has failed.
DrvArrControllerFailed.Message: The drive array controller located in %1 has failed.
DrvArrControllerFailed.Resolution: Reboot the server or replace the controller.

DrvArrControllerOK.Description: The drive array controller is operating properly.
DrvArrControllerOK.Message: The drive array controller located in %1 is opearting properly.

DrvArrLogDrvBadConnect.Description: A physical drive is not responding.
DrvArrLogDrvBadConnect.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 cannot connect to the physical drive.

DrvArrLogDrvErasing.Description: The logical drive is currently being erased.
DrvArrLogDrvErasing.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently being erased.

DrvArrLogDrvExpanding.Description: The logical drive is currently undergoing a transformation.
DrvArrLogDrvExpanding.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently undergoing a transformation.

DrvArrLogDrvFailed.Description: The drive array logical drive has failed.
DrvArrLogDrvFailed.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 has failed.
DrvArrLogDrvFailed.Resolution: Data loss has occurred. Replace the failed physical drive(s).

DrvArrLogDrvMultiPathAccessDegraded.Description: All disk drives of this logical drive had more than one I/O path to the controller, but now  one or more of them have only one I/O path.
DrvArrLogDrvMultiPathAccessDegraded.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 has multi-path access degraded.

DrvArrLogDrvNewLogDrvKeyRekeyRequestRece.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and has received a request to rekey all data with a new logical drive encryption key.The logical drive is online.
DrvArrLogDrvNewLogDrvKeyRekeyRequestRece.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and has received a request to rekey all data with a new logical drive encryption key.

DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedMissingKey.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed because the array controller has not yet received the encryption key from Management Processor.
DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedMissingKey.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed.
DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedMissingKey.Resolution: Consult the HPE Secure Encryption Installation and User Guide for troubleshooting.

DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedWithControl.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed because the array controller does not have encryption enabled.
DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedWithControl.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and cannot be accessed because the array controller does not have encryption enabled.
DrvArrLogDrvNoAccessEncryptedWithControl.Resolution: Consult the HPE Secure Encryption Installation and User Guide for troubleshooting.

DrvArrLogDrvNotAvailable.Description: The logical drive is currently unavailable.
DrvArrLogDrvNotAvailable.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently unavailable.

DrvArrLogDrvOK.Description: The logical drive is in normal operation mode.
DrvArrLogDrvOK.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is in normal operation mode.

DrvArrLogDrvOverheating.Description: The drive array enclosure that contains the logical drive is overheating.
DrvArrLogDrvOverheating.Message: The drive array enclosure that contains the drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is overheating.
DrvArrLogDrvOverheating.Resolution: The drive array is still functioning, but should be shutdown.

DrvArrLogDrvPredictiveSpareRebuildReady.Description: The logical drive is ready to perform a predictive spare rebuild.
DrvArrLogDrvPredictiveSpareRebuildReady.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready to perform a predictive spare rebuild.

DrvArrLogDrvQueuedForExpansion.Description: The logical drive is ready for transformation.
DrvArrLogDrvQueuedForExpansion.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready for transformation.

DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationInP.Description: The logical drive is currently undergoing rapid parity initialization.
DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationInP.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently undergoing rapid parity initialization.

DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationPen.Description: The logical drive is currently pending rapid parity initialization and will be unavailable.
DrvArrLogDrvRapidParityInitializationPen.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently pending rapid parity initialization and will be unavailable.

DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Description: The drive array logical drive is ready for Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is ready for Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvReadyRebuild.Resolution: The failed physical drive has been replaced, but the logical drive is still operating in Interim Recovery Mode.

DrvArrLogDrvRebuilding.Description: The drive array logical drive is currently doing Automatic Data Recovery.
DrvArrLogDrvRebuilding.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently doing Automatic Data Recovery.

DrvArrLogDrvRecovering.Description: The drive array logical drive is using Interim Recovery Mode.
DrvArrLogDrvRecovering.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is using Interim Recovery Mode.
DrvArrLogDrvRecovering.Resolution: At least one physical drive has failed, but no data has been lost.

DrvArrLogDrvRekeyInProgress.Description: The logical drive is currently encrypted and all data is currently being rekeyed with a new logical drive key using the background capacity expansion transformation task.
DrvArrLogDrvRekeyInProgress.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently encrypted and all data is currently being rekeyed with a new logical drive key using the background capacity expansion transformation task.

DrvArrLogDrvShutdown.Description: The drive array enclosure that contains the logical drive has overheated.
DrvArrLogDrvShutdown.Message: The drive array enclosure that contains the drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 has overheated. The logical drive is no longer functioning.
DrvArrLogDrvShutdown.Resolution: Ensure that the array enclosure is being cooled properly.

DrvArrLogDrvUnconfigured.Description: The drive array logical drive is not configured.
DrvArrLogDrvUnconfigured.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is not configured.

DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Description: The logical drive is currently being transformed from unencrypted to encrypted and the volume is online.
DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 is currently being transformed from unencrypted to encrypted and the volume is online.

DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Description: The logical drive has received a request to transform from unencrypted to encrypted but this process has not yet started.The unencrypted logical drive is currently online.
DrvArrLogDrvUnencryptedToEncryptedTransf.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 has received a request to transform from unencrypted to encrypted but this process has not yet started.

DrvArrLogDrvWrongDrive.Description: The wrong physical drive was replaced after a physical drive failure.
DrvArrLogDrvWrongDrive.Message: The drive array logical drive %1 on controller located in %2 was replaced with the wrong physical drive.

DrvArrPhysDrvEraseDone.Description: The drive array physical drive has been erased and is is now in an offline state.
DrvArrPhysDrvEraseDone.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has been erased and is now in an offline state.

DrvArrPhysDrvEraseQueued.Description: An erase operation is currently queued for the drive array physical drive.
DrvArrPhysDrvEraseQueued.Message: An erase operation is currently queued for the drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2.

DrvArrPhysDrvErasing.Description: The drive array physical drive is being erased.
DrvArrPhysDrvErasing.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is being erased.

DrvArrPhysDrvFailed.Description: The drive array physical drive has failed.
DrvArrPhysDrvFailed.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed.

DrvArrPhysDrvNotAuthenticated.Description: The drive array physical drive could not be authenticated as a genuine HPE hard drive.
DrvArrPhysDrvNotAuthenticated.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 could not be authenticated as a genuine HPE hard drive.
DrvArrPhysDrvNotAuthenticated.Resolution: Replace the drive with a genuine HPE hard drive.

DrvArrPhysDrvOK.Description: The drive array physical drive is functioning properly.
DrvArrPhysDrvOK.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is functioning properly.

DrvArrPhysDrvPredictiveFailure.Description: The drive array physical drive has a predictive failure error.
DrvArrPhysDrvPredictiveFailure.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has a predictive failure error.

DrvArrPhysDrvWearOut.Description: The drive array physical drive is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DrvArrPhysDrvWearOut.Message: The drive array physical drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes.
DrvArrPhysDrvWearOut.Resolution: Replace the drive as soon as possible.

DrvArrSolidStateDiskFiftySixDayThreshold.Description: The solid state disk will reach the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out) within fifty-six days.
DrvArrSolidStateDiskFiftySixDayThreshold.Message: The solid state disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 will reach the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out) within fifty-six days.
DrvArrSolidStateDiskFiftySixDayThreshold.Resolution: Modify your write workload or plan to replace your SSD drive.

DrvArrSolidStateDiskFivePercentThreshold.Description: The solid state disk has passed the five percent threshold and is at or below five percent of reaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).
DrvArrSolidStateDiskFivePercentThreshold.Message: The solid state disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has passed the five percent threshold and is at or below five percent of reaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).
DrvArrSolidStateDiskFivePercentThreshold.Resolution: Plan to replace your SSD drive.

DrvArrSolidStateDiskTwoPercentThresholdP.Description: The solid state disk has passed the two percent threshold and is at or below five percent of reaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).
DrvArrSolidStateDiskTwoPercentThresholdP.Message: The solid state disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has passed the two percent threshold and is at or below five percent of reaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).
DrvArrSolidStateDiskTwoPercentThresholdP.Resolution: Plan to replace your SSD drive.

DrvArrSolidStateDiskWearOK.Description: The solid state disk is not in any imminent danger of wear out.
DrvArrSolidStateDiskWearOK.Message: The solid state disk  at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is not in any imminent danger of wear out.

DrvArrSolidStateDiskWearOut.Description: The solid state disk is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).
DrvArrSolidStateDiskWearOut.Message: The solid state disk at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is approaching the maximum usage limit for writes (wear out).

DrvArrSpareDriveActive.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has completed Automatic Data Recovery.

DrvArrSpareDriveBuilding.Description: A physical drive has failed. Automatic Data Recovery is in progress to recover data to the on-line spare.
DrvArrSpareDriveBuilding.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has Automatic Data Recovery in progress.

DrvArrSpareDriveFailed.Description: The on-line spare has failed and is no longer available for use.
DrvArrSpareDriveFailed.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed and is no longer available for use.

DrvArrSpareDriveInactive.Description: An on-line spare is configured, but is not currently in use.
DrvArrSpareDriveInactive.Message: Drive array spare drive at location %1 connected to controller in %2 is configured, but is not currently in use.

DrvArrayAccBoardBadData.Description: The cache module board has lost backup power. If data was being stored in the cache module memory when the server lost power, that data has been lost.
DrvArrayAccBoardBadData.Message: The cache module board located in %1 has lost backup power. Data may have been lost.
DrvArrayAccBoardBadData.Resolution: Verify that no data has been lost. Investigate the cause of the failure and take corrective action.

DrvArrayAccBoardBatteryFailed.Description: The cache module board backup power source has failed.
DrvArrayAccBoardBatteryFailed.Message: The cache module board backup power source has failed for controller located in %1.

DrvArrayAccBoardEnabled.Description: Cache operations are currently configured and enabled for at least one logical drive.
DrvArrayAccBoardEnabled.Message: The cache module board located in %1 is configured and enabled for at least one logical drive.

DrvArrayAccBoardInvalid.Description: Cache module board is not installed in this system or is present but not configured.
DrvArrayAccBoardInvalid.Message: The cache module board is not installed in %1 or is installed but not configured.
DrvArrayAccBoardInvalid.Resolution: Install and/or configure the cache module board.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BackupPower.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because a backup power source has been hot removed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BackupPower.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because a backup power source has been hot removed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BackupPower.Resolution: Consult the HPE Array Configuration Utility User Guide for troubleshooting.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BadMirrorDa.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the mirrored copies of data do not match.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BadMirrorDa.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the mirrored copies of data do not match.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BadMirrorDa.Resolution: Data may have been lost, and you should service the board.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BatteryNotS.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because one or more attached batteries are not supported by the currently running firmware.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_BatteryNotS.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because one or more attached batteries are not supported by the currently running firmware.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_CapacitorCh.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to insufficient capacitor power.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_CapacitorCh.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled due to insufficient capacitor power.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_CapacitorFa.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module capacitor has failed to charge.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_CapacitorFa.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module capacitor has failed to charge.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ChargerCirc.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the charger circuit on the flash backed cache module has failed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ChargerCirc.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the charger circuit on the flash backed cache module has failed.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ConfigComma.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the configuration of the logical drives has changed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ConfigComma.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the configuration of the logical drives has changed.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ExcessiveEC.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the number of cache lines experiencing excessive ECC errors has reached the preset limit.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ExcessiveEC.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the number of cache lines experiencing excessive ECC errors has reached the preset limit.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because because the flash backed cache module backup operation has failed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module backup operation has failed.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module has encountered a hardware failure.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module has encountered a hardware failure.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because because the flash backed cache module restore operation has failed.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_FlashBacked.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the flash backed cache module restore operation has failed.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_Incompatibl.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because an incompatible cache module is being used.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_Incompatibl.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because an incompatible cache module is being used.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NoCapacitor.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because there are no capacitors attached to the flash backed cache module.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NoCapacitor.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because there are no capacitors attached to the flash backed cache module.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NoCapacitor.Resolution: Check the status of the flash backed cache module.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NotEnoughBa.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because there are not enough batteries attached to the controller.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NotEnoughBa.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because there are not enough batteries attached to the controller.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NotSupporte.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the current cache module is not supported by the currently running firmware.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_NotSupporte.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the current cache module is not supported by the currently running firmware.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_PostECCErro.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled due to a large number of ECC errors detected while testing the cache during POST.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_PostECCErro.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled due to a large number of ECC errors detected while testing the cache during POST.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ReadFailure.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because memory parity errors have occurred.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ReadFailure.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the mirrored copies of data do not match.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_ReadFailure.Resolution: Data has been lost, and you should service the board.

DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_WriteFailur.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because data could not be written to write cache memory in duplicate due to the detection of parity errors.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_WriteFailur.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled due to the detection of parity errors.
DrvArrayAccBoardPermDisabled_WriteFailur.Resolution: You should service the chache module board.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BadConfigur.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to bad configuration.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BadConfigur.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1  have been temporarily disabled bceause the cache module board was configured for a different controller.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BadConfigur.Resolution: Rerun the configuration utility and ensure that the board has been properly configured for this system.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BoardNotCon.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because the cache module board has been configured but is not currently attached to the controller.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BoardNotCon.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because the cache module board has been configured but is not currently attached to the controller.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_BoardNotCon.Resolution: Check the alignment of the board and connections.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_DisableComm.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled by the driver.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_DisableComm.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled by the driver.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_ExpandInPro.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to an expand of a logical drive.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_ExpandInPro.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled due to an expand of a logical drive.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_LowBatteryP.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled while the energy pack is charging.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_LowBatteryP.Message: Write cache operations for the controller located in %1 has been temporarily disabled while the energy pack is charging.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_LowBatteryP.Resolution: No action needed. Write cache operations will be automatically enabled after the energy pack charges.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_MegaCellNot.Description: Write cache operations have been permanently disabled because the megacell is not cabled.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_MegaCellNot.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been permanently disabled because the megacell is not cabled.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_NoResources.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because the controller does not have sufficient resources to perform write cache operations.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_NoResources.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because the controller does not have sufficient resources to perform write cache operations.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RAID_ADG_En.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because the RAID ADG Enabler Module is broken or missing.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RAID_ADG_En.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because the RAID ADG Enabler Module is broken or missing.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RAID_ADG_En.Resolution: Replace or install the ADG Enabler Module.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantCa.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because the cache on the redundant controller has failed.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantCa.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because the cache on the redundant controller has failed.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantLo.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because redundant controller has insufficient cache battery power.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantLo.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because redundant controller has insufficient cache battery power.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantSi.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled because the cache sizes on the redundant controllers do not match.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_RedundantSi.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled because the cache sizes on the redundant controllers do not match.

DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_SnapshotInP.Description: Write cache operations have been temporarily disabled due to a snapshot operation that is queued up or in progress.
DrvArrayAccBoardTempDisabled_SnapshotInP.Message: Write cache operations for cache module board located in %1 have been temporarily disabled due to a snapshot operation that is queued up or in progress.

EmbeddedMediaSecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of the management processor's embedded media device has failed.
EmbeddedMediaSecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of the management processor's embedded media device has failed.
EmbeddedMediaSecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Retry Secure Erase. Please contact HPE support if issue persists.

EnclosureManagerFirmwareMismatch.Description: The Enclosure Manager firmware version is below the minimum supported version.
EnclosureManagerFirmwareMismatch.Message: Chassis Enclosure Serial Number %1 requires minimum firmware revision 0x%2.0x%3. It is currently 0x%4.0x%5.

FanDegraded.Description: The specified fault tolerant fan is now in a degraded state.
FanDegraded.Message: Fan %1 is now in a degraded state.

FanFailed.Description: The specified fault tolerant fan has failed.

FanInserted.Description: A fault tolerant fan has been inserted into the specified fan location.
FanInserted.Message: The fan has been inserted in fan location %1.

FanRedundancyLost.Description: The fault tolerant fans have lost redundancy.
FanRedundancyLost.Message: The fans are no longer redundant.
FanRedundancyLost.Resolution: Check the system fans for a failure.

FanRedundancyRestored.Description: The fault tolerant fans have returned to a redundant state.

FanRemoved.Description: A fault tolerant fan has been removed from the specified fan location.
FanRemoved.Message: The fan has been removed from fan location %1.

FirmwareFlashStatusChanged.Description: The firmware flash status has changed
FirmwareFlashStatusChanged.Message: The firmware flash status is now %1

FirmwareIntegrityScanComplete.Description: This event is generated when a firmware integrity issue is found during firmware scan irrespective of a recovery success or failure.
FirmwareIntegrityScanComplete.Message: Management Processor completed the firmware integrity scan and detected an anomaly.

FirmwareRecoveryRequest.Description: This event is generated when firmware recovery is requested.

FirmwareValidationAutoRepairFailed.Description: Integrated Lights-Out failed to automatically repair the integrity scan issue.
FirmwareValidationAutoRepairFailed.Message: Integrated Lights-Out failed to automatically repair the %1 firmware.
FirmwareValidationAutoRepairFailed.Resolution: The indicated firmware must be manually updated. The server should not be rebooted until this has been addressed.

FirmwareValidationScanErrorRepaired.Description: Firmware integrity scan or boot time validation issue reported has been repaired.
FirmwareValidationScanErrorRepaired.Message: The %1 firmware integrity anomaly or boot time validation previously detected has been repaired.

FirmwareValidationScanFailed.Description: The firmware integrity scan or boot time validation detected an anomaly that requires the firmware to be updated.
FirmwareValidationScanFailed.Message: The firmware integrity scan or boot time validation detected an anomaly that requires the %1 firmware to be updated.
FirmwareValidationScanFailed.Resolution: If configured for auto-recovery, the repair attempt will happen automatically. If not configured or if it does not succeed, then manual recovery is needed. If the anomaly was detected as part of OS boot time validation, then a manual recovery is needed.

HeNvdimmControllerFirmwareError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Controller Firmware Error. The controller firmware has been corrupted. The OS will not use the NVDIMM.
HeNvdimmControllerFirmwareError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Controller Firmware Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2. The controller firmware has been corrupted. The OS will not use the NVDIMM.
HeNvdimmControllerFirmwareError.Resolution: Re-program the firmware to restore NVDIMM functionality.

HeNvdimmLifecycleWarning.Description: NVDIMM Lifecycle Warning. NVDIMM lifetime has reached.
HeNvdimmLifecycleWarning.Message: NVDIMM Lifecycle Warning - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). NVDIMM lifetime has reached.
HeNvdimmLifecycleWarning.Resolution: Backup NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data and replace NVDIMM.

HeNvdimmSanitizationOk.Description: NVDIMM Sanitization Ok. This NVDIMM-N was selected for Sanitizing/Erasing. All data saved in the NVDIMM has been erased.
HeNvdimmSanitizationOk.Message: NVDIMM - Processor %1, DIMM %2 .This NVDIMM-N was selected for Sanitizing/Erasing. All data saved in the NVDIMM has been erased.
HeNvdimmSanitizationOk.Resolution: Re-program the firmware to restore NVDIMM functionality.

HoodRemoved.Description: System hood is removed or not in a properly installed state. This situation may result in improper cooling of the system due to air flow changes caused by the missing hood.
HoodRemoved.Resolution: Ensure that the server chassis hood was intentionally removed and the server is secure. Replace the cover, ensuring it is properly installed. Verify the system is in working order.

HoodRemovedOnPowerOff.Description: BIOS detected a system hood removal when server power was off.
HoodRemovedOnPowerOff.Message: Hood was removed from the unit when server power was off.
HoodRemovedOnPowerOff.Resolution: Ensure that the server chassis hood was intentionally removed and that the server is secure.

HoodReplaced.Resolution: Ensure that the server chassis hood was intentionally replaced, and the server is secure.

ILOToInsightRemoteSupportCommunicationFa.Description: Management Processor to Insight Remote Support or Insight Online communication failed.
ILOToInsightRemoteSupportCommunicationFa.Message: Management Processor to Insight Remote Support or Insight Online communication failure.
ILOToInsightRemoteSupportCommunicationFa.Resolution: Please check the connectivity to Insight Remote Support or Insight Online Host.

IPMIWatchdogTimerReset.Description: The Management processor detected a watchdog timer timeout. The failsafe timer was not periodically addressed after it was armed in the operating system.
IPMIWatchdogTimerReset.Message: The Management processor detected IPMI watchdog timer timeout. Details: %1.
IPMIWatchdogTimerReset.Resolution: Review management processor event logs and any relevant operating system history for additional information.

IdeAtaSecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of SATA drive has failed.
IdeAtaSecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of SATA drive has failed: ( Controller %1, Disk %2, Serial Number %3, Failure Type %4 )
IdeAtaSecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Please refer the IML Troubleshooting guide or click on Learn More link for additional information and any necessary action to be taken.

IndicatorLEDStateChanged.Description: The state of the indicator LED has changed
IndicatorLEDStateChanged.Message: The state of the indicator LED is now %1

InletAmbientPreCautionThresAlert.Description: Inlet Ambient temperature sensor user defined Pre-Caution threshold level exceeded.
InletAmbientPreCautionThresAlert.Message: Inlet Ambient temperature sensor user defined Pre-Caution threshold exceeded

IntelligentDiagnosticsEnabled.Description: Intelligent Diagnostics Enabled: Server will attempt automated recovery.
IntelligentDiagnosticsEnabled.Message: Intelligent Diagnostics Enabled: Server will attempt automated recovery.

IntelligentDiagnosticsExit.Description: Intelligent Diagnostics Exit: Automated server recovery has concluded.
IntelligentDiagnosticsExit.Message: Intelligent Diagnostics Exit: Automated server recovery has concluded.

InterlockFailureErrorPowerOn.Description: The server had a power fault that occurred while attempting to power on.
InterlockFailureErrorPowerOn.Message: The device %1 is missing or improperly seated. The server had a power fault that occurred while attempting to power on.
InterlockFailureErrorPowerOn.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server.

InterlockFailureErrorRuntime.Description: The server was shut down due to a power fault that occurred while it was powered on.
InterlockFailureErrorRuntime.Message: The device %1 is missing or improperly seated. The server was shut down due to a power fault that occurred while it was powered on.
InterlockFailureErrorRuntime.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server.

InterlockFailureErrorStandby.Description: The server had a power fault that occurred while it was powered off.
InterlockFailureErrorStandby.Message: The device %1 is missing or improperly seated. The server had a power fault that occurred while it was powered off.
InterlockFailureErrorStandby.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server.

InterlockFailureErrorUnknown.Description: The server had a power fault but the reason is unknown.
InterlockFailureErrorUnknown.Message: The device %1 is missing or improperly seated. The server had a power fault but the reason is unknown.
InterlockFailureErrorUnknown.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server.

IntrusionHWInstalled.Description: System intrusion alert hardware is installed.

IntrusionHWRemoved.Description: System intrusion alert hardware is removed.
IntrusionHWRemoved.Resolution: There is no action required if the removal of the hardware is expected.  If the hardware was not intentionally removed, please verify cable connection.

LiquidCoolingModuleDegraded.Description: The specified Liquid cooling Module is now in a degraded state.
LiquidCoolingModuleDegraded.Message: Liquid Cooling Module %1 is now in a degraded state.
LiquidCoolingModuleDegraded.Resolution: Check Server documentation to be sure the liquid cooling module configuration meets the functional requirements of the server and replace the Module accordingly.

LiquidCoolingModuleFailed.Description: The specified Liquid Cooling module has failed.
LiquidCoolingModuleFailed.Resolution: Check Server documentation to be sure the liquid cooling module configuration meets the functional requirements of the server and replace the Module accordingly.

LiquidCoolingModuleRedundancyLost.Description: The Liquid Cooling Module has lost redundancy.
LiquidCoolingModuleRedundancyLost.Message: The Liquid cooling Module is no longer redundant.
LiquidCoolingModuleRedundancyLost.Resolution: Add or Replace the Liquid Cooling Module.

LiquidCoolingModuleRedundancyRestored.Description: The liquid cooling modules have returned to a redundant state.
LiquidCoolingModuleRedundancyRestored.Message: The liquid cooling modules have are now redundant.

MetricValueBelowLowerThreshold.Description: Metric value is below user defined lower threshold.
MetricValueBelowLowerThreshold.Message: %1 is below user defined lower threshold.
MetricValueBelowLowerThreshold.Resolution: Please check the current configured server workload.

MetricValueExceededUpperThreshold.Description: Metric value exceeded user defined upper threshold.
MetricValueExceededUpperThreshold.Resolution: Please check the current configured server workload.

MirroredMemoryEngaged.Description: Advanced Memory Protection Mirrored Memory Engaged. The Advanced Memory Protection subsystem has detected a memory fault. Mirrored Memory has been activated.
MirroredMemoryEngaged.Message: The Advanced Memory Protection subsystem has engaged the online spare memory.

NVMeSecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of NVMe drive has failed.
NVMeSecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of NVMe drive has failed : ( Bus %1, Device %2, Function %3, Serial Number %4, Failure Type %5 )
NVMeSecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Please refer the IML Troubleshooting guide or click on Learn More link for additional information and any necessary action to be taken.

NicAllLinksDown.Description: The physical adapter has had a function up at any point and transitions to having all of its functions down.
NicAllLinksDown.Message: All links down in adapter in slot %1.
NicAllLinksDown.Resolution: Check the connection to the adapter and validate the connectivity from the server to any external device, including the cabling. If no problems are found, the adapter or other connectivity device may need replacement.

NicAllLinksDownRepaired.Description: The physical adapter has had a function up at any point and transitions to having all of its functions down and then has one if its functions return to up.
NicAllLinksDownRepaired.Message: At least a link repaired in adapter in slot %d.

NicConnectivityLost.Description: The physical adapter in a single adapter configuration failed or at least one physical adapter in a logical adapter group failed.
NicConnectivityLost.Message: Connectivity lost for adapter in slot %1, port %2.
NicConnectivityLost.Resolution: Check the connection to the adapter and validate the connectivity from the server to any external device, including the cabling. If no problems are found, the adapter or other connectivity device may need replacement.

NicConnectivityRestored.Description: The physical adapter in a single adapter configuration returns to the OK condition or at least one physical adapter in a logical adapter group returns to the OK condition.
NicConnectivityRestored.Message: Connectivity is restored for adapter in slot %1, port %2.

NoPowerSupplyDetected.Description: Power Supply or Power Backplane Detection Error.
NoPowerSupplyDetected.Message: No Power Supply or Power Backplane were Detected.
NoPowerSupplyDetected.Resolution: Ensure that system CPLD and, if applicable, chassis firmware is up to date.

NvdimmArmingError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Arming Error. NVDIMM could not be armed and future backups are not possible.
NvdimmArmingError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Arming Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). NVDIMM could not be armed and future backups are not possible.
NvdimmArmingError.Resolution: Save NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data and then replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmBackupError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Backup Error detected. Persistent data backup failed and data is not available.
NvdimmBackupError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Backup Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). Persistent data backup failed and data is not available.
NvdimmBackupError.Resolution: Save NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data and then replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmBackupPowerError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Backup Power Error. Backup power is not available and a future backup is not possible.
NvdimmBackupPowerError.Message: NVDIMM Error - NVDIMM backup power has been lost and a future backup is not possible. Data from the last successful backup is intact, but data modified after the last successful backup will be lost if power cannot be restored.
NvdimmBackupPowerError.Resolution: Ensure backup power is available. Backup NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data.

NvdimmBatteryNotChargedwithNoWait.Description: Smart battery is not charged sufficiently to support the NVDIMMs installed in the system.
NvdimmBatteryNotChargedwithNoWait.Message: NVDIMM Battery Not Charged - No Wait.

NvdimmBatteryNotChargedwithWait.Description: Smart battery is not charged sufficiently to support the NVDIMMs installed in the system.

NvdimmConfigurationError.Description: One or more NVDIMM Configuration errors occurred. Details of the NVDIMM Configuration error messages can be found in Integrated Management Log
NvdimmConfigurationError.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on NVDIMM Configuration error.

NvdimmControllerError.Description: NVDIMM Error - NVDIMM Controller Error. An error was found with the NVDIMM controller. The OS will not use the NVDIMM.
NvdimmControllerError.Message: NVDIMM Error - NVDIMM Controller Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). An error was found with the NVDIMM controller. The OS will not use the NVDIMM.
NvdimmControllerError.Resolution: Update the NVDIMM FW. If issue persists, replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmEraseError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Erase Error. NVDIMM could not be erased and future backups are not possible.
NvdimmEraseError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Erase Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). NVDIMM could not be erased and future backups are not possible.
NvdimmEraseError.Resolution: Save NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data and then replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmEventNotifyError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Unable to set event notification for this NVDIMM.
NvdimmEventNotifyError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (SN:%3-%4-%5-%6). Unable to set event notification for this NVDIMM to generate alerts for health changes, including a loss of data persistency.
NvdimmEventNotifyError.Resolution: Update the NVDIMM FW. If issue persists, replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmInitializationError.Description: Persistent Memory Address Range Scrub has detected an error.
NvdimmInitializationError.Message: Persistent Memory Address Range Scrub has detected an error.
NvdimmInitializationError.Resolution: Update System ROM and Innovation Engine firmware to latest supported revision. Contact support if issue persists.

NvdimmInterleaveOff.Description: NVDIMM Error - Controller Interleave Off. Received a memory initialization or uncorrectable error. All NVDIMMs on Processor are disabled.
NvdimmInterleaveOff.Message: NVDIMM Error - Controller Interleave Off - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). Received a memory initialization or uncorrectable error. All NVDIMMs on Processor %7 are disabled.
NvdimmInterleaveOff.Resolution: Sanitize all NVDIMMs on the processor. If problem persists, replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmInterleaveOn.Description: NVDIMM Error - Controller Interleave On. Received a memory initialization or uncorrectable error. All NVDIMMs on Processor are disabled.
NvdimmInterleaveOn.Message: NVDIMM Error - Controller Interleave On - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). Received a memory initialization or uncorrectable error. All NVDIMMs on Processor %7 are disabled.
NvdimmInterleaveOn.Resolution: Sanitize all NVDIMMs on the processor. If problem persists, replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmLogicalNvdimmError.Description: One or more Logical NVDIMM errors occurred. Details of the Logical NVDIMM error messages can be found in Integrated Management Log
NvdimmLogicalNvdimmError.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on Logical NVDIMM Errors.

NvdimmMemoryMapChanged.Description: Uncorrectable Memory Error. The failed memory module could not be determined.
NvdimmMemoryMapChanged.Message: NVDIMM Memory Map changed, due to uncorrectable memory error.
NvdimmMemoryMapChanged.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on NVDIMM error.

NvdimmPersistantMemoryAddressError.Description: Persistent Memory Address Range Scrub has detected an error.
NvdimmPersistantMemoryAddressError.Message: Persistent Memory Address Range Scrub has detected an error.
NvdimmPersistantMemoryAddressError.Resolution: If the Operating System is unable to recover, check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

NvdimmPersistencyLost.Description: NVDIMM Error - Persistency Lost.  NVDIMM Persistency is lost and future data backup is not available.
NvdimmPersistencyLost.Message: NVDIMM Error - Persistency Lost - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). NVDIMM Persistency is lost and future data backup is not available.
NvdimmPersistencyLost.Resolution: Backup the data and replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmPersistencyRestored.Description: NVDIMM - Persistency Restored.  NVDIMM Persistency is restored and future data backup is available.
NvdimmPersistencyRestored.Message: NVDIMM - Persistency Restored - Processor %1, DIMM %2. NVDIMM Persistency is restored and future data backup is available.

NvdimmRestoreError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Restore Error detected. Persistent data restore failed and data is not available.
NvdimmRestoreError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Restore Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). Persistent data restore failed and data is not available.

NvdimmSanitizationError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Sanitization Error. This NVDIMM-N was selected for Sanitizing/Erasing, but this process was not successful.
NvdimmSanitizationError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Sanitization Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). This NVDIMM-N was selected for Sanitizing/Erasing, but this process was not successful.
NvdimmSanitizationError.Resolution: Save NVDIMM contents to other media to preserve data and then replace the NVDIMM.

NvdimmUncorrectableMemoryError.Description: NVDIMM Error - Uncorrectable Memory Error detected. This NVDIMM will not be available to the operating system.
NvdimmUncorrectableMemoryError.Message: NVDIMM Error - Uncorrectable Memory Error - Processor %1, DIMM %2 (Serial no. %3-%4-%5-%6). This NVDIMM will not be available to the operating system.

OSSecurityAdd.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a new module was added.
OSSecurityAdd.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a new OS kernel module: %1.
OSSecurityAdd.Resolution: Verify module was a valid new module.

OSSecurityCfgChange.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security configuration change.
OSSecurityCfgChange.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security detected a configuration change to the software monitoring system.
OSSecurityCfgChange.Resolution: Verify configuration change to software verification settings is valid.

OSSecurityHeartbeat.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security heartbeat timeout.
OSSecurityHeartbeat.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security detected loss of heartbeat from kernel.
OSSecurityHeartbeat.Resolution: Verify security scanning software is installed and operating properly. Possible intrusion disabled scanning software.

OSSecurityKernelModuleCorrection.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security detected an unexpected correction in OS Kernel Module
OSSecurityKernelModuleCorrection.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security scanning the operating system kernel found a possible rollback of kernel corruption in %1
OSSecurityKernelModuleCorrection.Resolution: Verify that the correction for Kernel Module is intentional and done by authorized administrator on Host OS.

OSSecurityPIDCOW.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a copy on write issue with process.
OSSecurityPIDCOW.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a copy on write modification to process: %1.

OSSecurityPIDDel.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a library deleted or renamed in process.
OSSecurityPIDDel.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a library deleted or renamed in process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDDel.Resolution: Verify process is running and approved version.

OSSecurityPIDEnvar.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a possible malicious enviroment variable in process.
OSSecurityPIDEnvar.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a possible malicious variable in process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDEnvar.Resolution: Verify environment variables have not been compromised.

OSSecurityPIDHeartbeat.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a heartbeat issue with process.
OSSecurityPIDHeartbeat.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a heartbeat issue with process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDHeartbeat.Resolution: Verify process is running and approved version.

OSSecurityPIDInject.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a library injection issue with process.
OSSecurityPIDInject.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a library injection in process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDInject.Resolution: Verify process is running and approved version.

OSSecurityPIDMemfd.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a memfd library issue with process.
OSSecurityPIDMemfd.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a memfd issue with process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDMemfd.Resolution: Verify process is running and approved version.

OSSecurityPIDMisc.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a miscellaneous issue in process.
OSSecurityPIDMisc.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a miscellaneous issue in process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDMisc.Resolution: Verify system has not been compromised.

OSSecurityPIDPath.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found a lib path issue with process.
OSSecurityPIDPath.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found a lib path not in reference list for process: %1.
OSSecurityPIDPath.Resolution: Verify process is running and approved version.

OSSecurityRemove.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found an OS Kernel module was removed.
OSSecurityRemove.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security found an OS Kernel module was removed: %1.

OSSecurityScan.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security found an OS Kernel Corruption.
OSSecurityScan.Message: HPE OS Security found an OS Kernel Corruption: %1.
OSSecurityScan.Resolution: Shutdown server and determine the cause of the corruption.

OSSecurityUnexpectedChange.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security detected an unexpected configuration change in OS Kernel.
OSSecurityUnexpectedChange.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security detected a change to the kernel or kernel modules while iLO was being reset.
OSSecurityUnexpectedChange.Resolution: Verify changes made to kernel modules or kernel settings are valid.

OSSecurityUpdateTimeout.Description: HPE Trusted OS Security update timeout.
OSSecurityUpdateTimeout.Message: HPE Trusted OS Security timed out waiting on updated scan tables from host driver.
OSSecurityUpdateTimeout.Resolution: Reload host driver to reinitialize scan tables.

OverallSecStateAtRisk.Description: The overall security state of the system is at risk.
OverallSecStateAtRisk.Message: Overall security state of the system is at risk.
OverallSecStateAtRisk.Resolution: Refer to iLO User Manual or iLO Security Dashboard help page.

OverallSecStatusChange.Message: Overall security status changed from %1 to Risk.
OverallSecStatusChange.Resolution: Refer to iLO User Manual or iLO Security Dashboard help page.

PCIeDiskTemperatureFailed.Description: The temperature of the disk has crossed the upper critical threshold.
PCIeDiskTemperatureFailed.Message: The temperature of the PCIe disk at location %1 has crossed the upper critical threshold.
PCIeDiskTemperatureFailed.Resolution: Check the system for hardware failures and verify the environment is properly cooled.

PCIeDiskTemperatureOk.Description: The PCIe Disk`s temperature has returned to the normal operating range.
PCIeDiskTemperatureOk.Message: The temperature of the PCIe disk at location %1 is normal.

PCIeDriveAddedOrPowerOn.Description: A PCI device has been added to the system or powered on.
PCIeDriveAddedOrPowerOn.Message: A PCI device at Bus %1, Device %2, Function %3 has been added to the system or powered on.

PCIeDriveConditionDegraded.Message: The status of the PCIe disk at location %1 is degraded.

PCIeDriveConditionFailed.Message: The status of the PCIe disk at location %1 is failed.

PCIeDriveConditionOk.Message: The status of the PCIe disk at location %1 is ok.

PCIeDriveRemovedOrPowerOff.Description: A PCI device has been removed from the system or powered off.
PCIeDriveRemovedOrPowerOff.Message: A PCI device at Bus %1, Device %2, Function %3 has been removed from the system or powered off.

PCIeDriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold.Description: PCIe disk wear status threshold is FiftySixDayThreshold.
PCIeDriveWearStatusFiftySixDayThreshold.Message: The PCIe disk wear status for the disk at location %1 is FiftySixDayThreshold.

PCIeDriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold.Description: PCIe disk wear status threshold is FivePercentThreshold.
PCIeDriveWearStatusFivePercentThreshold.Message: The PCIe disk wear status for the disk at location %1 is FivePercentThreshold.

PCIeDriveWearStatusOk.Description: PCIe disk wear status is ok.
PCIeDriveWearStatusOk.Message: The PCIe disk wear status for the disk at location %1 is ok.

PCIeDriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold.Description: PCIe disk wear status threshold is TwoPercentThreshold.
PCIeDriveWearStatusTwoPercentThreshold.Message: The PCIe disk wear status for the disk at location %1 is TwoPercentThreshold.

PCIeDriveWearStatusWearOut.Description: PCIe disk wear status threshold is wear out.
PCIeDriveWearStatusWearOut.Message: The PCIe disk wear status for the disk at location %1 is wear out.
PCIeDriveWearStatusWearOut.Resolution: Replace the disk the status indicate wear out.

PMMConfigError.Description: One or more PMem Configuration errors occurred.
PMMConfigError.Message: The indicated Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has configuration error(s)(Processor number %1 DIMM number %2).
PMMConfigError.Resolution: Review documentation for more information on supported configurations.

PMMHealthFailure.Description: An Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has experienced an issue and is no longer operational/resilient.
PMMHealthFailure.Message: An Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has experienced an issue and is no longer operational/resilient (Processor number %1 DIMM number %2).
PMMHealthFailure.Resolution: Backup Intel Optane PMem for HPE contents to other media to preserve data and replace the PMem.

PMMLessUsageRemainingAlert.Description: An Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module Percentage Remaining Alert. The Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has less usage remaining. Future errors on this Persistent Memory Module may result in loss of data.
PMMLessUsageRemainingAlert.Message: An Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module Percentage Remaining Alert - (Processor number %1 DIMM number %2).
PMMLessUsageRemainingAlert.Resolution: Backup Persistent Memory Module contents to other media to preserve data immediately and replace the PMem.

PMMSecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has failed.
PMMSecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module has failed: ( Processor %1, DIMM %2, Serial Number %3 )
PMMSecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Retry Secure Erase. Please contact support if issue persists.

PMMShutdownWarning.Description: Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module Health Warning. Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module reported an unsafe shutdown.
PMMShutdownWarning.Message: Intel Optane PMem for HPE Module reported an unsafe shutdown (Processor number %1 DIMM number %2).
PMMShutdownWarning.Resolution: Check Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information. If the issue persists, check if the system firmware is latest, including the system programmable logic device and system ROM. Check power supply and replace if needed.

POSTErrorsOccurred.Description: One or more POST errors occurred. Power On Self-Test (POST) errors occur during the server restart process. Details of the POST error messages can be found in Integrated Management Log
POSTErrorsOccurred.Message: Power on self-test errors occurred during server restart.
POSTErrorsOccurred.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on the Power on self-test error.

PciResetFail.Description: System is unable to perform a reset on the PCI controller in slot.
PciResetFail.Message: System is unable to perform a reset on the PCI controller in slot %1.
PciResetFail.Resolution: Update pci Configuration controller firmware and retry the secure erase operation. If the issue persists, contact HPE support.

PowerDegradedEventDetected.Description: A degraded power event has been detected and the server system board should be replaced.
PowerDegradedEventDetected.Message: A degraded power event has been detected and the server system board should be replaced.
PowerDegradedEventDetected.Resolution: Power down and remove the server from power to have the server system board replaced.

PowerFailureCpuThermalTrip.Description: The server was shut down because the CPU temperature sensor was above the allowed threshold.
PowerFailureCpuThermalTrip.Message: The CPU temperature sensor was above the allowed threshold in area: %1, group: %2 .
PowerFailureCpuThermalTrip.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureErrorBadFuse.Description: The server was shut down because one or more fuses tripped.
PowerFailureErrorBadFuse.Message: One or more fuses in area: %1, group: %2 tripped. The server was shut down.
PowerFailureErrorBadFuse.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureErrorInputPowerLoss.Description: The server was shut down because the input power source was removed.
PowerFailureErrorInputPowerLoss.Message: The input power source in area: %1, group: %2, was removed. The server was shut down.
PowerFailureErrorInputPowerLoss.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureErrorTempAboveCritical.Description: The server was shut down because a temperature sensor was above the critical threshold.
PowerFailureErrorTempAboveCritical.Message: A temperature sensor in area: %1, group: %2, was above the critical threshold. The server was shut down.
PowerFailureErrorTempAboveCritical.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailurePowerOn.Description: The server had a power fault while attempting to power on.
PowerFailurePowerOn.Message: A power fault in area: %1, group: %2, has occured while attempting to power on the server.
PowerFailurePowerOn.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureRuntime.Description: The server was shut down due to a power fault that occurred while it was powered on.
PowerFailureRuntime.Message: A power fault in area: %1, group: %2, has occured while the server was powered on.
PowerFailureRuntime.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureStandby.Description: The server had a power fault that occurred while it was powered off.
PowerFailureStandby.Message: A power fault in area: %1, group: %2, has occured while the server was powered off..
PowerFailureStandby.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerFailureUnknown.Description: The server had a power fault but the reason is unknown.
PowerFailureUnknown.Message: A power fault occured in area: %1, group: %2, but the reason is unknown.
PowerFailureUnknown.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details. Try the following steps until the error no longer occurs: a) Remove the AC power, and then restore AC power. Attempt to boot the server. (b) Remove and then reinstall the failed device. Attempt to boot the server. (c) Swap the failed device with a known good device and attempt to boot the server.

PowerProtectionFault.Message: System Board Power Protection Fault Detected.
PowerProtectionFault.Resolution: Check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

PowerRedundancyLost.Description: The fault tolerant power supplies have lost redundancy.
PowerRedundancyLost.Message: The power supplies are no longer redundant.
PowerRedundancyLost.Resolution: Check the system power supplies for a failure.

PowerRedundancyRestored.Description: The fault tolerant power supplies have returned to a redundant state.
PowerRedundancyRestored.Message: The power supplies are now redundant.

PowerSupplyACPowerLoss.Description: Power supply AC power loss for the specified power bay location.
PowerSupplyACPowerLoss.Message: Power supply AC power loss detected power bay %1
PowerSupplyACPowerLoss.Resolution: Check the power source for the specified power supply.

PowerSupplyDegraded.Description: The fault tolerant power supply in the specified bay location is degraded.
PowerSupplyDegraded.Message: The fault tolerant power supply in bay location %1 is degraded.

PowerSupplyFailed.Description: The fault tolerant power supply in the specified bay location has failed.
PowerSupplyFailed.Message: The fault tolerant power supply in bay location %1 has failed.

PowerSupplyInserted.Description: A fault tolerant power supply has been inserted into the specified bay location.
PowerSupplyInserted.Message: A power supply has been inserted in bay %1.

PowerSupplyOK.Description: The fault tolerant power supply in the specified bay location is orperating normally.
PowerSupplyOK.Message: The power supply in  bay location %1 is opearting normally.

PowerSupplyRemoved.Description: A fault tolerant power supply has been removed from the specified bay location.
PowerSupplyRemoved.Message: A power supply has been removed from bay %1.

PowerThresholdBreach.Message: Power threshold has been exceeded (Warning Type: %1, Threshold: %2 watts, Duration: %3 minutes)

ProcessorStatusDegraded.Description: Processor status changed. Processor can be brought down to Stop state and removed from O.S Active set
ProcessorStatusDegraded.Message: The state of the processor in slot %1 is degraded.
ProcessorStatusDegraded.Resolution: Update the system firmware. If the issue persists, check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for recommended action.

ProcessorStatusDisabled.Description: Processor status changed. Processor brought down to Stop state and removed from O.S Active set
ProcessorStatusDisabled.Message: The state of the processor in slot %1 is disabled.
ProcessorStatusDisabled.Resolution: Update the system firmware. If the issue persists, check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for recommended action.

ProcessorStatusFailed.Description: Processor status changed. Processor brought down to Stop state and removed from O.S Active set
ProcessorStatusFailed.Message: The state of the processor in slot %1 is failed.
ProcessorStatusFailed.Resolution: Update the system firmware. If the issue persists, check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for recommended action.

ProcessorStatusOK.Description: Processor status changed. Processor brought back to Running state and made member of O.S Active set
ProcessorStatusOK.Message: The state of the processor in slot %1 is OK.

ProcessorStatusUnknown.Description: Processor status changed. Processor can be brought down to Stop state and removed from O.S Active set or Brought back to Running state and made member of O.S Active set
ProcessorStatusUnknown.Message: The state of the processor in slot %1 is unknown.
ProcessorStatusUnknown.Resolution: Update the system firmware. If the issue persists, check the Integrated Management Log (IML) for recommended action.

PwrSupplyError.Message: System Power Supply: %1 (Power Supply  chassis %2, bay %3)
PwrSupplyError.Resolution: Check error condition and the Integrated Management Log (IML) for additional information.

PwrSupplyErrorRepaired.Message: System Power Supply Repaired: : %1 (Power Supply  chassis %2, bay %3)

RemoteSupportRegistrationComplete.Description: The server was registered to Remote Support.
RemoteSupportRegistrationComplete.Message: The server was registered to Remote Support using the %1 method

RemoteSupportUnregistrationComplete.Description: The server was unregistered from Remote Support.
RemoteSupportUnregistrationComplete.Message: The server was unregistered from Remote Support.

SEDPassPhraseFailed.Description: Device Encryption Error. Enabling or Disabling encryption/modifying pass phrase failed.
SEDPassPhraseFailed.Message: Failed to do selected Enabling or Disabling encryption/pass phrase modification operation on Processor %1 DIMM %2.
SEDPassPhraseFailed.Resolution: Retry with correct pass phrase. If issue persists contact HPE support.

SEDUnlockFailed.Description: Three wrong attempts were made to unlock Self Encrypting Device. The device will be locked until the next reboot.
SEDUnlockFailed.Message: Failed to unlock Self Encrypting Device on Processor %1 DIMM %2.

SNMPAuthenticationFailure.Description: An unauthorized user attempted to access the Management Processor via SNMP
