SPISecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of System Firmware Configuration has failed.
SPISecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of System Firmware Configuration has failed
SPISecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Retry Secure Erase. Please contact HPE Support if issue persists.

SeCpuUncorrectableError.Message: Uncorrectable error was detected on processor %1.
SeCpuUncorrectableError.Resolution: Re-seat the processor and update to the latest firmware. If the issue persists contact support.

SecureBootAuthCertFail.Description: Secure Boot Authentication Failure - The image was not authorized due to revoked certificate(s) and was not executed.
SecureBootAuthCertFail.Message: Secure Boot Authentication Failure - The image on %1 was not authorized due to revoked certificate(s) and was not executed.
SecureBootAuthCertFail.Resolution: Update the image to a new version where the certificate used to sign the image and the image hash are not in the Secure Boot forbidden database (DBX).

SecureBootAuthFail.Description: Secure Boot Authentication Failure - The image failed authentication and was not executed.
SecureBootAuthFail.Message: Secure Boot Authentication Failure - The image on %1 failed authentication and was not executed.
SecureBootAuthFail.Resolution: Update the image to known good trusted version. If current image is trusted, then update the Secure Boot allowed database (DB) with the certificate or image hash.

SecurityOverrideDisengaged.Description: Security override disengaged. Management Processor firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the disengaged position.
SecurityOverrideDisengaged.Message: Management Processor firmware has detected the security override jumper has been disengaged.

SecurityOverrideEngaged.Description: Security override engaged. Management Processor firmware has detected the security override jumper has been toggled to the engaged position.
SecurityOverrideEngaged.Message: Management Processor firmware has detected the security override jumper has been engaged.

ServerHardwareSignatureChanged.Description: The server hardware signature has changed. This can be caused by addition or removal of Mezziane cards or relocation of the server.
ServerHardwareSignatureChanged.Message: The server hardware signature is now %1

ServerOperational.Description: The server is operational again. The server has previously been shutdown due to a thermal anomaly on the server and has just become operational again.
ServerOperational.Message: Server is operational again after thermal shutdown.

ServerPostComplete.Description: The server has reached Power On Self Test complete.
ServerPostComplete.Message: The server has reached Power On Self Test complete

ServerPostDiscoveryComplete.Description: The server has completed device discovery.
ServerPostDiscoveryComplete.Message: The server has completed device discovery.

ServerPowerOnFailure.Description: A request was made to power on the server, however the server could not be powered on due to a failure condition.
ServerPowerOnFailure.Message: The server could not be powered on.
ServerPowerOnFailure.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on why the server could not be powered on.

ServerPoweredOff.Description: The server has been powered off.
ServerPoweredOff.Message: The server has been powered off.

ServerPoweredOn.Description: The server has been powered on.
ServerPoweredOn.Message: The server has been powered on.

ServerResetDetected.Description: Server Reset Detected. Management Processor firmware has detected a server reset.
ServerResetDetected.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log for details on the cause of the server reset.

SmartArraySecureEraseFailed.Description: Secure Erase of Smart Array has failed.
SmartArraySecureEraseFailed.Message: Secure Erase of Smart Array has failed : ( Controller Index %1, Drive Index %2, Drive Bay %3, Serial Number %4 )
SmartArraySecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Retry Secure Erase. Please contact HPE Support if issue persists.

StorageSystemConnected.Description: The storage system connection to controller is working normally.
StorageSystemConnected.Message: The storage system in location %1 connected to controller in %2 is working normally.

StorageSystemFanDegraded.Description: At least one storage system fan has failed, but there is still sufficient cooling capacity to allow the system to continue.
StorageSystemFanDegraded.Message: The storage system fan in location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed, but there is still sufficient cooling capacity to allow the system to continue.

StorageSystemFanFailed.Description: One or more storage system fans have failed.
StorageSystemFanFailed.Message: The storage system fan in location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed
StorageSystemFanFailed.Resolution: Replace the failing fan(s) immediately to avoid hardware damage.

StorageSystemFanOK.Description: All storage system fan are working normally.
StorageSystemFanOK.Message: The storage system fans connected to controller in %1 are working normally.

StorageSystemNoFan.Description: This unit does not support fan monitoring.
StorageSystemNoFan.Message: The storage system connected to controller in %1 does not support fan monitoring.

StorageSystemNoPwrSupply.Description: The storage system does not support fault tolerant power supply monitoring.
StorageSystemNoPwrSupply.Message: The storage system in location %1 connected to controller %2 does not support fault tolerant power supply monitoring.

StorageSystemNoTemperature.Description: The storage system does not support temperature monitoring.
StorageSystemNoTemperature.Message: The storage system in location %1 connected to controller in %2 does not support temperature monitoring.

StorageSystemNotConnected.Description: The storage system is not connected to the controller.
StorageSystemNotConnected.Message: The storage system in location %1 is not connected to controller %2.
StorageSystemNotConnected.Resolution: Please restore the connectivity of storage system to the adapter.

StorageSystemNotSupported.Description: This unit does not support connected controller.
StorageSystemNotSupported.Message: The storage system in location %1 does not support to controller %2.

StorageSystemPwrSupplyDegraded.Description: One of the power supply units in the fault tolerant power supply in the storage system has failed.
StorageSystemPwrSupplyDegraded.Message: One of the power supply units in the storage system in location %1 connected to controller in %2 has failed.
StorageSystemPwrSupplyDegraded.Resolution: Restore power or replace the failed power supply.

StorageSystemPwrSupplyOK.Description: The power supplies in the storage system are working normally.
StorageSystemPwrSupplyOK.Message: The power supplies in the storage system in location %1 connected to controller in %2 are working normally.

StorageSystemTemperatureDegraded.Description: The storage system temperature is outside of normal operating range.
StorageSystemTemperatureDegraded.Message: The temperature in the storage system in location %1 connected to controller in %2 is outside of normal operating range.
StorageSystemTemperatureDegraded.Resolution: Shutdown the storage system as soon as possible. Ensure that the storage system environment is being cooled properly and that no components are overheated.

StorageSystemTemperatureFailed.Description: The storage system temperature could permanently damage the system.The storage system will automatically shutdown.
StorageSystemTemperatureFailed.Message: The storage system temperature in location %1 connected to controller in %2 can permanently damage the system.
StorageSystemTemperatureFailed.Resolution: Shutdown the storage system as soon as possible. Ensure that the storage system environment is being cooled properly and that no components are overheated.

StorageSystemTemperatureOK.Description: The storage system temperature is within normal operating range.
StorageSystemTemperatureOK.Message: The temperature in location %1 connected to controller in %2  is within normal operating range.

SystemBatteryFailed.Description: The system energy pack has either failed or met a pre-failure warning condition for the specified location.
SystemBatteryFailed.Message: The energy pack has either failed or met a pre-failure warning condition in location %1.

SystemBatteryRemoved.Description: The system energy pack has been removed in the specified location.
SystemBatteryRemoved.Message: The energy pack has been removed in location %1.
SystemBatteryRemoved.Resolution: Refer to the Smart Storage energy pack issues section in Troubleshooting Guide for HPE ProLiant servers for further troubleshooting.

SystemPowerAllocationNotOptimized.Description: Error in setting server power throttle. Server enclosure power request has increased. Server power allocation is not optimized.
SystemPowerAllocationNotOptimized.Message: Server power allocation could not be optimized. Server Enclosure power request has increased
SystemPowerAllocationNotOptimized.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log on the Management Processor for details. Power down & reinsert the server blade.

SystemPowerOnDenied.Description: One of the Field Replacement Units(FRU) is not allowing the system to power on.
SystemPowerOnDenied.Resolution: Refer to the Integrated Management Log on the Management Processor for details. Power down & reinsert the server blade.

TPMSecureEraseFailed.Description: Trusted Platform Module has failed the Secure Erase Operation.
TPMSecureEraseFailed.Message: Trusted Platform Module has failed the Secure Erase Operation
TPMSecureEraseFailed.Resolution: Update Trusted Platform Module firmware and retry the secure erase operation. If the issue persists, contact HPE support.

TestAlert.Message: This is a test alert message:  %1.

ThermalStatusDegradedSysContinue.Description: The server's temperature is outside of the normal operating range in the specified location. The server will continue operation.
ThermalStatusDegradedSysContinue.Message: The server's temperature is outside of the normal operating range in location %1.The server will continue operation.
ThermalStatusDegradedSysContinue.Resolution: Check the system for hardware failures and verify the environment is properly cooled.

ThermalStatusDegradedSysShutdown.Description: The server's temperature is outside of the normal operating range in the specified location. The server will be shutdown.
ThermalStatusDegradedSysShutdown.Message: The server's temperature is outside of the normal operating range in location %1. The server will be shutdown.
ThermalStatusDegradedSysShutdown.Resolution: Check the system for hardware failures and verify the environment is properly cooled.

ThermalStatusFailure.Description: The temperature status has been set to failed in the specified chassis and location.
ThermalStatusFailure.Resolution: Check the system for hardware failures and verify the environment is properly cooled.

ThermalStatusOK.Description: The server's temperature has returned to the normal operating range in the specified location.
ThermalStatusOK.Message: The server's temperature has returned to the normal operating range in location %1.

USBStorageDeviceReadError.Description: A read error occurred on the USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceReadError.Message: A read error occurred on the Flash Media in Slot %1 of a USB storage device attached to the system.

USBStorageDeviceRedundancyLost.Description: Redundancy is lost on the USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceRedundancyLost.Message: Redundancy is lost on Flash Media in Slot %1 of USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceRedundancyLost.Resolution: Replace the failed USB Storage Device.

USBStorageDeviceRedundancyRestored.Description: Redundancy is restored on a USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceRedundancyRestored.Message: Redundancy is restored on a USB storage device attached to the system.

USBStorageDeviceSyncFailed.Description: Sync operation to restore redundancy failed on a USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceSyncFailed.Message: Sync operation to restore redundancy failed on a USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceSyncFailed.Resolution: Replace the failed USB Storage Device.

USBStorageDeviceWriteError.Description: A write error occurred on the USB storage device attached to the system.
USBStorageDeviceWriteError.Message: A write error occurred on the Flash Media in Slot %1 of a USB storage device attached to the system.

UnauthorizedLoginAttempts.Description: Management Processor firmware has detected multiple unauthorized login attempts.
UnauthorizedLoginAttempts.Message: Management Processor firmware has detected more than %1 unauthorized login attempts.
UnauthorizedLoginAttempts.Resolution: Check the Management Processor event log for more information on the login failure.

UnsupportedPowerSupplyUnitDetected.Description: Power supply installed is not supported by the processor.
UnsupportedPowerSupplyUnitDetected.Message: The Power supply Unit installed in bay location %1 is not supported.

UnsupportedPowerSupplyUnitRemoved.Description: Unsupported Power supply unit is removed.
UnsupportedPowerSupplyUnitRemoved.Message: Unsupported Power supply unit at bay location %1 has been removed.

UpdateTaskStateChanged.Description: An update task has changed state.

iLODriveComponentAdded.Description: A component was added to the iLO Drive.
iLODriveComponentAdded.Message: The component "%1" was added to the iLO Drive

iLORestServicesStarted.Message: RESTful services started. Management Processor Firmware Version: %1, Release date: %2
